node.title: Is Kroger Accepting Bitcoin Cash? Grocer Says Memo About Cryptocurrency Is Not Real
node.description: "This communication was fraudulent and is unfounded and should be disregarded," Kroger said about a news release that said it would accept the cryptocurrency.

node.title: Arbery's killers "did everything" on assumptions, prosecutor says
node.description: "He tried to run around their truck and get way from these strangers, total strangers, who had already told him that they would kill him. And then they killed him."

node.title: How to Track Runners in the New York City Marathon
node.description: Spectators can track runners online and on an app in real time on race day.

node.title: Florida Wants to Replace Its State Bird and Everyone Has an Opinion On What It Should Be
node.description: The scrub jay, the osprey, the flamingo and the roseate spoonbill are among the suggestions to replace the mockingbird as Florida's state bird.

node.title: Children Shot While Waiting in North Carolina Burger King Drive-Thru
node.description: The two children, ages 2 and 11, suffered non-life-threatening injuries and were not suspected to be the target of the shooting, according to authorities.

node.title: Supreme Court case could "rip" disability laws, advocates warn
node.description: The Supreme Court justices will hear arguments next month in a case that could have far-reaching effects on disability rights.

node.title: When the Solution Is the Problem
node.description: Reshaping a team to suit a single player comes with a heavy cost: The thrills fade, and the problems remain.

node.title: University of Florida Reverses Course to Allow Professors to Testify Against State
node.description: Facing a storm of protest, the university said three professors could testify as expert witnesses in a voting-rights lawsuit against the state.

node.title: John Kerry lauds progress at the climate summit but warns, ‘Job not done.’
node.description: Mr. Kerry, President Biden’s climate envoy, acknowledged that many of the promises being put forward in Glasgow were only that — promises.

node.title: Mystery of Black Hole's Powerful Near-Light-Speed Jets May Be Solved
node.description: Researchers may now understand how the supermassive black hole at the heart of M87 launches a jet of plasma spreading across thousands of light-years.

node.title: Satellite Images Show Walruses Gathered on Coast Due to Sea Ice Loss
node.description: The animals were spotted via satellite imagery as feeding patterns have been disrupted by melting ice, according to a study.

node.title: University of Florida Will Allow Professors to Testify in Lawsuit After Backlash
node.description: The lawsuit looks to take down a state law that opponents say impedes voting rights.

node.title: NZ-affiliated Afghans unfairly denied visas, court told
node.description: Lawyers acting for Afghans unable to get visas to come here have told the High Court the government has not acted fairly.

node.title: Analyst who linked Trump to Kremlin charged with lying to FBI
node.description: A Russian analyst who worked on a dossier that made unsubstantiated claims linking Donald Trump to the Kremlin has been arrested in the US.

node.title: Smithsonian Moves Toward Returning Benin Bronzes
node.description: The institution’s National Museum of African Art says it has removed the artworks from display. It is the latest museum to promise to repatriate the works to Nigeria.

node.title: Hunter Biden: Emotionally Honest, Generically Smooth
node.description: The president’s son has turned to art as a career. “The Journey Home” is his first solo exhibition.

node.title: At Hunter Biden’s Art Show, Line, Color and Questions
node.description: Paintings by the president’s son are drawing visitors to a gallery in SoHo, and also criticism from those who worry that purchasers might hope to be buying not just art, but access.

node.title: Congress Is Investigating McKinsey Over Its Role in the Opioid Crisis
node.description: A House committee has requested documents related to the firm’s advice to drug makers and potential conflicts of interest with the F.D.A.

node.title: In her opening statement, the lead prosecutor says Ahmaud Arbery was ‘under attack.’
node.description: The prosecution detailed how three defendants chased Mr. Arbery in two pickup trucks and the confrontation that ended with his death.

node.title: House Democrats Hit Another Wall on Path to Passing Biden Agenda
node.description: "We're working on it," House Majority Leader Steny Hoyer told reporters amid stalling over a lengthy procedural maneuver on the chamber's floor.

node.title: Nurse Faces Four Years in Prison for Allegedly Leaving Sick Inmate on Floor to Die
node.description: Danalee Pascua has been charged in the 2019 death of inmate Elisa Serna after allegedly leaving her alone for an hour after she collapsed.

node.title: U.S. Appoints New Coordinator to Investigate 'Havana Syndrome' as More Reports Surface
node.description: The American government is trying to find out what is causing symptoms in line with brain trauma in hundreds of its diplomats and intelligence officers.

node.title: Case of 4-Year-Old Killed Reopened After Convicted Man Exonerated, Released After 28 Years
node.description: The case was reopened after a local Philadelphia news outlet ran a true-crime series about the young girl's death.
